channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: China’s gig workers stress over their incomes as Baidu ‘silly radish’ robotaxis flood the streets
item.description: More than 500 electric robotaxis built by Baidu Inc. currently ply Wuhan's streets, with plans for an additional 1,000 to be deployed by year-end.

item.title: 5 things to know before the stock market opens Thursday
item.description: Here are the most important news items that investors need to start their trading day.

item.title: Moderna’s stock slides 12% after it lowers full year sales guidance
Bank of England makes first interest rate cut since pandemic in nail-bitingly close vote
item.description: The “finely balanced” 5-4 vote signals the Bank's ongoing caution to further reductions, with no guidance given on where interest rates may settle.

item.title: Wayfair CEO likens home goods slowdown to 2008 financial crisis: 'Customers remain cautious'
item.description: Online home goods company Wayfair has seen sluggish demand against high interest rates, but repreive could come if the federal reserve cuts rates in September

item.title: Bank of England cuts rates for first time in over four years
Americans: If you want to move abroad because of the election, Spain is your best bet
item.description: Looking to leave the U.S. amid the political upheaval? If you can do your job remotely, research shows that Spain comes out on top.

item.title: U.S. rugby star Ilona Maher says Olympic bronze medal may have saved the team
item.description: Ilona Maher reflects on bringing U.S. Rugby its first Olympic medal, the state of women's sports and the growth of rugby.

item.title: Shell beats expectations as cost-cutting plans boost profitability
Cities no longer need to be rich to be smart as AI ‘levels out the playing field,’ urban experts say
item.description: Data can help cities who are not that rich become 'smart' and the cost of data collection is coming down because of advances in AI.

item.title: Three 'pain trades:' Bank of America tells clients to be on the right side of these market moves
item.description: Heading into year's end, Bank of America sees three "pain trades" that investors should look out for.

item.title: Latest beat-and-raise boosts Rolls-Royce, one of Europe’s hottest stocks
Trump tried to sway the Fed and now Powell is fighting back
item.description: Fighting words: "We're a non political agency. We don't want to be involved in politics in any way."

item.title: Biogen beats expectations, hikes outlook as Alzheimer's drug and other new products gain traction
item.description: Uptake of Biogen's breakthrough Alzheimer's drug, Leqembi, appears to be picking up, with roughly $40 million in sales for the quarter.

item.title: Volkswagen’s profits slump in face of mounting competition from China
